snippet: Senator Lamar Alexander’s bill would allow states to devise curriculum standards, tests, school rating systems and consequences for schools that fail to meet state goals with far fewer guidelines.
abstract: Republican Sen Lamar Alexander is introducing legislation to revise No Child Left Behind education law, signaling preference for much smaller role for federal government in public schooling; bill will compete with measure introduced by Democratic Sen Tom Harkin.
lead_paragraph: Senator Lamar Alexander’s bill would allow states to devise curriculum standards, tests, school rating systems and consequences for schools that fail to meet state goals with far fewer guidelines.

headline.main: G.O.P. Bill on Schools Would Set Fewer Rules
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Bill On Schools Would Set Fewer Rules
